alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 4:02PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS EXPECTED FROM THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... Strong north to northeasterly winds are expected across the Matanuska Valley and West Anchorage later this week. Winds will begin increasing Thursday night, peaking between Friday morning and afternoon. Currently, forecast peak gusts are 60 mph in Matanuska Valley and 35 mph in West Anchorage. There remains uncertainty with the timing and strength of maximum wind gusts. Motorists are urged to use caution while traveling as gusty winds may affect the Friday morning and evening commute. Blowing snow may occur if winds resuspend fallen snow, though visibility reductions are not expected to be widespread. Be sure to secure loose objects and monitor the forecast for updates.
